maya/beastmayaplugin/src/mayathreading.cpp
/*

Use of this software is subject to the terms of the Autodesk license agreement
provided at the time of installation or download, or which otherwise 
accompanies this software in either electronic or hard copy form.

#include "mayathreading.h"
#include <maya/MSpinLock.h>
#include <maya/MGlobal.h>

#include <windows.h>

namespace beastmaya {

AsyncHandler* AsyncHandler::m_instance = 0;

void mayaExitingCallback(void* clientData) {
        AsyncHandler* ah = (AsyncHandler*)clientData;
        ah->terminateAndJoinAll();
        MThreadAsync::release();
}

AsyncHandler::AsyncHandler() : m_asyncTaskCount(0) {
        MThreadAsync::init();
        MStatus res;
        m_exitCallbackId = MSceneMessage::addCallback(MSceneMessage::kMayaExiting, mayaExitingCallback, this, &res);
}

AsyncHandler::~AsyncHandler() {
        MMessage::removeCallback(m_exitCallbackId);
        terminateAndJoinAll();
        MThreadAsync::release();
}

AsyncHandler* AsyncHandler::getInstance() {
        if (!m_instance) {
                static AsyncHandler i;
                m_instance = &i;
        }
        return m_instance;
}

MThreadRetVal AsyncHandler::runAsyncTask(void* data) {
        AsyncTask* task = (AsyncTask*)data;
        AsyncHandler* me = getInstance();

        task->threadMain();

        // Task is done. Remove it from map but keep the reference long enough to release the lock first.
        AsyncTaskPtr taskp;
        me->m_asyncThreadLock.lock();
        ThreadMap::iterator tmi = me->m_threadMap.find(task->m_name);
        if (tmi != me->m_threadMap.end()) {
                taskp = tmi->second;
                me->m_threadMap.erase(tmi);
        }
        me->m_asyncThreadLock.unlock();

        return 0;
}

void AsyncHandler::destroyAsyncTask(void* data) {
        AsyncHandler* me = getInstance();
        me->m_asyncThreadLock.lock();
        me->m_asyncTaskCount--;
        me->m_asyncThreadLock.unlock();
}

bool AsyncHandler::start(AsyncTaskPtr task) {

        if (isRunning(task->m_name)) {
                // There's already a task running with this name. Not ok.
                return false;
        }

        if (!task->init()) {
                // Initialization failed. Not ok.
                return false;
        }

        m_asyncThreadLock.lock();
        m_threadMap[task->m_name] = task;
        m_asyncTaskCount++;
        m_asyncThreadLock.unlock();

        MThreadAsync::createTask(runAsyncTask, (void *)task.get(), destroyAsyncTask, NULL);

        return true;
}

bool AsyncHandler::isRunning(const std::wstring& name) {
        m_asyncThreadLock.lock();
        bool running = m_threadMap.find(name) != m_threadMap.end();
        m_asyncThreadLock.unlock();
        return running;
}

AsyncTaskPtr AsyncHandler::getAsyncTask(const std::wstring& name) {
        m_asyncThreadLock.lock();
        ThreadMap::iterator tmi = m_threadMap.find(name);
        if (tmi == m_threadMap.end()) {
                m_asyncThreadLock.unlock();
                return AsyncTaskPtr();
        } else {
                m_asyncThreadLock.unlock();
                return tmi->second;
        }
}

void AsyncHandler::requestTermination(const std::wstring& name) {
        m_asyncThreadLock.lock();
        ThreadMap::iterator tmi = m_threadMap.find(name);
        if (tmi != m_threadMap.end()) {
                tmi->second->requestTermination();
        }
        m_asyncThreadLock.unlock();
}

void AsyncHandler::terminateAndJoinAll() {
        // Tell them it's time to stop.
        m_asyncThreadLock.lock();
        for (ThreadMap::iterator tmi = m_threadMap.begin(); tmi != m_threadMap.end(); tmi++) {
                tmi->second->requestTermination();
        }
        m_asyncThreadLock.unlock();

        // Wait until all tasks are finished.
        int numThreads = -1;
        while (numThreads != 0) {
                m_asyncThreadLock.lock();
                numThreads = m_asyncTaskCount;
                m_asyncThreadLock.unlock();
                Sleep(10);
        }
}

}
